concepts.title: REPL & Scripts
concepts.description: Use the interactive prompt (REPL) to try small ideas, and save code in .py files to run as scripts.
concepts.code:
>>> 2 + 2
4
>>> print('Hello')
Hello

# hello.py
print('Hello, world!')

# Run in terminal
# python3 hello.py

concepts.title: Variables & Types
concepts.description: Names point to values. Basic types: int, float, bool, str. Collections: list, tuple, dict, set.
concepts.code:
answer = 42            # int
pi = 3.14              # float
ok = True              # bool
name = 'Ada'           # str
nums = [1, 2, 3]       # list (mutable)
point = (3, 4)         # tuple (immutable)
user = {'name': name}  # dict (key-value)
tags = {'py', 'code'}  # set (unique)
print(type(nums), user['name'])

concepts.title: Strings & f-strings
concepts.description: Use single, double, or triple quotes. f-strings format values directly in text.
concepts.code:
greet = 'Hello'
name = 'Ada'
msg = f'{greet}, {name}! You have {3+2} messages.'
print(msg)
multiline = """This is
a multi-line string."""
print(multiline)

concepts.title: Operators
concepts.description: Arithmetic (+, -, *, /, //, %), comparisons (==, !=, <, >), and logical (and, or, not).
concepts.code:
a, b = 7, 3
print(a + b, a * b, a // b, a % b)
print(a == 7, b < a, not False, (a > 0) and (b > 0))

concepts.title: Control Flow
concepts.description: Use if/elif/else for decisions and for/while loops for repetition.

concepts.title: Functions
concepts.description: Group steps into reusable functions. Use defaults and return values.
concepts.code:
def greet(name='world'):
    return f'Hello, {name}!'

print(greet(), greet('Ada'))

# Docstring helps users and tools
def area(w: float, h: float) -> float:
    """Compute rectangle area in square units."""
    return w * h

print(area(3, 4))

concepts.title: Lists, Dicts, Sets, Tuples
concepts.code:
nums = [1, 2, 3]
nums.append(4)
first, *rest = nums
user = {'name': 'Ada', 'age': 36}
user['lang'] = 'Python'
tags = {'py', 'dev'}
tags.add('ai')
point = (3, 4)  # tuple
print(first, rest, user.get('lang'), 'py' in tags, point)

concepts.title: Comprehensions
Errors & Exceptions
concepts.description: Handle failures gracefully with try/except and clean up with finally.

concepts.title: Files & Paths
concepts.description: Use pathlib for paths and with-open to manage files.
concepts.code:
from pathlib import Path
path = Path('notes.txt')
path.write_text('Hello file!\n', encoding='utf-8')
print(path.read_text(encoding='utf-8'))
print('Exists?', path.exists())

concepts.title: Modules & Packages
concepts.description: Split code into files (modules) and folders (packages). Install libraries with pip.
concepts.code:
# utils.py
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

# main.py
from utils import add
print(add(2, 3))

# Install a package
# pip install requests

concepts.title: Type Hints
concepts.description: Annotate function parameters and variables to help tools catch mistakes.

concepts.title: Classes & Dataclasses
concepts.description: Model real-world things with classes. dataclass writes boilerplate for you.

concepts.title: Command Line (argparse)
concepts.description: Create user-friendly programs that accept options and flags.
concepts.code:
import argparse
parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Greeter')
parser.add_argument('--name', default='world')
args = parser.parse_args([])  # replace [] with actual args in real runs
print(f'Hello {args.name}!')

concepts.title: HTTP & JSON
concepts.description: Get data from the web and parse JSON.
concepts.code:
import json, urllib.request
with urllib.request.urlopen('https://httpbin.org/json') as r:
    data = json.load(r)
print(data['slideshow']['title'])

concepts.title: Async Basics
concepts.description: Use asyncio to run tasks concurrently (like multiple web requests).
concepts.code:
import asyncio, time

async def work(n):
    await asyncio.sleep(0.2)
    return f'done {n}'

async def main():
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    results = await asyncio.gather(*(work(i) for i in range(3)))
    print(results, 'in', round(time.perf_counter()-t0, 2), 's')

asyncio.run(main())

concepts.title: Testing (pytest)
concepts.description: Write small tests to check your code automatically.
concepts.code:
# test_math.py
from math import sqrt

def test_sqrt():
    assert sqrt(9) == 3

# Run tests
# pytest -q

concepts.title: Environments & pip
concepts.description: Create a virtual environment so each project has isolated packages.
concepts.code:
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # Windows: .venv\\Scripts\\activate
pip install requests pytest black
python -m pip list

quick_start.title: Install Python
quick_start.description: Install from python.org or using your OS package manager.
quick_start.code:
# macOS (Homebrew)
brew install python

# Ubuntu
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y python3 python3-pip

# Windows
# Download installer from https://www.python.org/downloads/

quick_start.title: Hello, World
quick_start.description: Create a script and run it.

quick_start.title: Virtual environment + pip
quick_start.code:
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate
pip install requests

tasks.title: Read a text file
tasks.code:
from pathlib import Path
text = Path('README.md').read_text(encoding='utf-8')
print(text[:200])

tasks.title: Write JSON
tasks.description: Serialize a dict to a JSON file.
tasks.code:
import json
data = {'ok': True, 'items': [1,2,3]}
with open('data.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    json.dump(data, f, indent=2)

tasks.title: Read CSV
tasks.description: Load rows from a CSV file.
tasks.code:
import csv
with open('people.csv', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    for row in csv.DictReader(f):
        print(row['name'], row['age'])

tasks.title: Write CSV
tasks.description: Write rows to a CSV file.
tasks.code:
import csv
rows = [{'name':'Ada','age':36},{'name':'Linus','age':54}]
with open('out.csv', 'w', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    w = csv.DictWriter(f, fieldnames=['name','age'])
    w.writeheader(); w.writerows(rows)

tasks.title: SQLite (database)
tasks.description: Create a table, insert, and query.
tasks.code:
import sqlite3
con = sqlite3.connect('app.db')
cur = con.cursor()
cur.execute('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS users (name TEXT, age INT)')
cur.executemany('INSERT INTO users VALUES (?, ?)', [('Ada',36),('Guido',68)])
for name, age in cur.execute('SELECT name, age FROM users ORDER BY age DESC'):
    print(name, age)
con.commit(); con.close()

tasks.title: ZIP files
tasks.code:
import zipfile, pathlib
# Create zip
with zipfile.ZipFile('site.zip', 'w', zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED) as z:
    z.write('index.html')
# Extract
pathlib.Path('unzipped').mkdir(exist_ok=True)
with zipfile.ZipFile('site.zip') as z:
    z.extractall('unzipped')

tasks.title: List files (glob)
GET JSON (stdlib)
tasks.code:
import json, urllib.request
with urllib.request.urlopen('https://httpbin.org/json') as r:
    data = json.load(r)
print(data['slideshow']['title'])

tasks.title: GET JSON
tasks.code:
import requests
r = requests.get('https://httpbin.org/json', timeout=10)
r.raise_for_status()
print(r.json())

tasks.title: POST JSON (requests)
tasks.description: Send data as JSON (pip install requests).
tasks.code:
# pip install requests
import requests
r = requests.post('https://httpbin.org/post', json={'ok': True}, timeout=10)
r.raise_for_status()
print(r.json()['json'])

tasks.title: Arguments
tasks.code:
import argparse
parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
parser.add_argument('--name', default='world')
print(f'Hello {parser.parse_args().name}!')

tasks.title: Find emails
tasks.code:
import re
text = 'Contact us: team@example.com or help@site.org'
print(re.findall(r'[\w.-]+@[\w.-]+', text))

tasks.title: Replace text
tasks.code:
import re
s = 'color colour'
print(re.sub(r'colou?r', 'shade', s))

tasks.title: Split / join
tasks.description: Split into words and join back.
tasks.code:
s = 'one two  three'
parts = s.split()
print(parts, ' | '.join(parts))

tasks.title: Read environment variables
tasks.code:
import os
port = int(os.environ.get('PORT', 8000))
mode = os.environ.get('MODE', 'dev')
print(port, mode)

tasks.title: Basic logging
tasks.code:
import logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO, format='%(levelname)s:%(message)s')
logging.info('Starting...')
logging.warning('Careful!')
logging.error('Something went wrong')

tasks.title: Thread pool
tasks.code:
from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor
import urllib.request
urls = ['https://example.com','https://httpbin.org/get']
with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=4) as ex:
    for html in ex.map(lambda u: urllib.request.urlopen(u).read(), urls):
        print(len(html))

builtins.name: bytearray.append
builtins.description: Append a single item to the end of the bytearray.

builtins.name: bytearray.center
builtins.description: Return a centered string of length width.

builtins.name: bytearray.clear
builtins.description: Remove all items from the bytearray.

builtins.name: bytearray.count
builtins.description: Return the number of non-overlapping occurrences of subsection 'sub' in bytes B[start:end].

builtins.description: Decode the bytearray using the codec registered for encoding.

builtins.description: Return True if the bytearray ends with the specified suffix, False otherwise.

projects.title: To-Do CLI
projects.summary: Add/list tasks saved to a JSON file.
projects.description: A simple command-line app that stores tasks in todo.json.

steps.title: Script
steps.code:
# todo.py
import argparse, json, pathlib
PATH = pathlib.Path('todo.json')

def load():
    return json.loads(PATH.read_text()) if PATH.exists() else []

def save(items):
    PATH.write_text(json.dumps(items, indent=2))

parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
parser.add_argument('cmd', choices=['add','list'])
parser.add_argument('text', nargs='?')
args = parser.parse_args([])  # replace [] with real args when running
items = load()
if args.cmd == 'add' and args.text:
    items.append({'text': args.text, 'done': False})
    save(items)
if args.cmd == 'list':
    for i, it in enumerate(items, 1):
        print(f"{i}. {'[x]' if it['done'] else '[ ]'} {it['text']}")

projects.title: CSV Summarizer
projects.summary: Compute quick stats from a CSV file.
projects.description: Reads a CSV and prints count and averages.

steps.title: Script
steps.code:
# summarize.py
import csv, statistics as stats
with open('data.csv', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    rows = list(csv.DictReader(f))
    ages = [int(r['age']) for r in rows if r.get('age')]
print('rows:', len(rows))
print('avg age:', round(stats.mean(ages), 1))

projects.title: Web Fetcher
projects.summary: Download JSON and save to disk.
projects.description: Fetch an API and store the response.

steps.title: Script
steps.code:
# fetch.py
import json, urllib.request, pathlib
url = 'https://httpbin.org/json'
with urllib.request.urlopen(url) as r:
    data = json.load(r)
pathlib.Path('out').mkdir(exist_ok=True)
open('out/data.json','w',encoding='utf-8').write(json.dumps(data, indent=2))
print('saved to out/data.json')

glossary.definition: A named reference to a value (e.g., x = 3).
Reusable block of code that can take inputs and return a value.
A .py file with code you can import.
Self-contained folder for project-specific Python and packages.
Batteries-included modules that ship with Python.
Interactive prompt where you can type and run Python line by line.
An error you can handle with try/except.
Something you can loop over (like list, str, file).
Compact way to build a list/dict/set from a loop.
Function that modifies another function or method.
Class helper that auto-generates __init__ and more for data fields.

tips.title: Indentation
tips.note: Use 4 spaces (not tabs) and keep it consistent.

tips.title: Virtualenv
tips.note: Create a venv per project; install packages inside it.

tips.title: Formatting
tips.note: Use f-strings for readable messages: f'User {name}'.

tips.title: Paths
tips.note: Prefer pathlib.Path over os.path for file work.

tips.title: Files
tips.note: Use with open(...) so files always close.

tips.title: Errors
tips.note: Catch specific exceptions (ValueError, FileNotFoundError), not bare except.

tips.title: Loops
tips.note: Use enumerate(list) instead of manual indexes.

tips.title: Help
tips.note: Use help(name) in the REPL to read docs quickly.
